definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: A sea urchin is nestled in a coral formation off Bonaire Island.
sentences.chinese: 一只海胆正舒适的藏在博内尔岛的珊瑚丛里。

sentences.english: The raised bumps on the white grain represent the sites of insertion for the sea urchin’s spines.
sentences.chinese: 白色颗粒上突起的肿块就是海胆脊柱的着生部位。

sentences.english: Skewer of lobster grilled on a plancha, topped with fennel, coral of sea urchin and caviar.
sentences.chinese: 香烤龙虾串，玉米面糊配海胆，茴香和鱼子酱。

sentences.english: The grains here are tiny fragments of a baby sea urchin shell.
sentences.chinese: 例如这些颗粒就是海胆幼体外壳上的碎片。

sentences.english: Feed on mollusks, sea urchins, hermit crabs, and crabs at night (Ref. 9680).
sentences.chinese: 吃软件动物，海胆，寄居蟹与螃蟹在晚上。

sentences.english: The spines of the omnivorous pencil-spined urchin extend outward from its body.
sentences.chinese: 这个铅笔状的杂食性海胆的刺从它们的身体里伸出来。

sentences.english: Echinoids are close relatives of the Asteroids.
Fish pick at the urchins, which feed on bits of algae.
sentences.chinese: 鱼类吃海胆，海胆以小块的藻类为食。

sentences.english: Fish pick at the urchins, which feed on bits of algae.
sentences.chinese: 鱼类吃海胆，海胆以小块的藻类为食。

sentences.english: For instance, it appears the ancestor of brainless starfish and sea urchins had a brain.
sentences.chinese: 例如，无脑海星和海胆的祖先似乎曾有大脑。

sentences.english: The spines of the omnivorous pencil-spined urchin extend outward from its body.
sentences.chinese: 这个铅笔状的杂食性海胆的刺从它们的身体里伸出来。

sentences.english: Sea urchins brandish their spines on the seafloor near the Channel Islands.
sentences.chinese: 海胆在海峡群岛附近的海底挥舞着它们的棘突。

sentences.english: Sea otters are the major predators of sea urchins.
sentences.chinese: 海獭是海胆的主要捕食者。

sentences.english: The bright red color of a fire urchin warns predators that its spines are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 火海胆鲜红的颜色警告捕食者它的刺有毒。

definition: the cylindrical adductor muscle of bivalve shellfish such as scallops
elephant trunk clam/geoduck (Panopea abrupta), large clam with a long proboscis (native to the west coast of North America)
